snippet: The Obama administration imposed sanctions on about two dozen Russians under a new law that has soured ties with Moscow, but avoided targeting many high-level government figures.
abstract: United States imposes new sanctions on about two dozen Russians accused of human rights violations, and Moscow vows to retaliate as dispute between the two countries escalates further into a cold war-style clash;  classified list of other violators is said to include Ramzan A Kadyrov, president of Chechnya.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration imposed sanctions on about two dozen Russians under a new law that has soured ties with Moscow, but avoided targeting many high-level government figures.

headline.seo: U.S. Sanctions on Russians Accused of Rights Violations
headline.main: U.S. Penalizes Russians for Human Rights Violations
headline.print_headline: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on Russians Accused of Human Rights Violations

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
